newsitem.title: UK: U.S. stocks in London at holiday standstill.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks in London at holiday standstill.

text.p: U.S. shares were a virtual standstill on Thursday as most European institutional investors took the day off in observance of the Ascension Day holiday.
Most major European bourses including those in Germany, France, Switzerland, and the Netherlands are shut and will not reopen until Friday.

"I haven't seen a single trade yet. Nobody is around," one dealer said. "Most of the Europeans will take Friday off as well so it will be quiet again tomorrow." In New York on Wednesday, the Dow Industrials Average plunged nearly 140 points to close at 7,085.65, unsettled by weak bond markets.
U.S. bonds suffered their worst loss in almost two months on Wednesday as economic statistics showed evidence of rising labour costs, while an auction of 10-year Treasuries fared poorly.
The June T-bond was down 5/32 to 109-25/32 while the yield on the benchmark 30-year long bond stood at 6.98 percent by 1005 GMT.
The June S&P 500 futures contract was down 2.75 points to 814.90.
